story.title: A Bento Box and a Lesson in Patience
story.content: During my first week in Tokyo, I got lost trying to find my host family's home. A kind old lady noticed my confusion and, without speaking a word of English, guided me through winding alleys. We shared a small lunch from her bento box — the moment I realized kindness transcends language.

ai_analysis.summary: An exchange student learns that compassion needs no translation.

story.title: Chalk Dust and New Horizons
story.content: In a small Kenyan village, I taught English to children who walked miles each day just to learn. They taught me Swahili songs in return. I came to teach language — but left understanding humanity.

ai_analysis.summary: A teacher’s journey that becomes a shared exchange of hope and knowledge.

story.title: Tea, Carpets, and Conversations
story.content: In Istanbul, I spent an afternoon drinking tea with a carpet seller who spoke passionately about his family's 200-year-old weaving tradition. We didn’t agree on everything, but we respected each other's worlds. That tea taught me more about diplomacy than any book ever did.

ai_analysis.summary: A spontaneous encounter that bridges centuries of culture over a cup of tea.

story.title: When Homesickness Became Home
story.content: I met Maria, a homesick student from Brazil, who spent nights crying over her family. We started cooking feijoada together every Sunday. Soon others joined, and our small kitchen became a world of its own — laughter, languages, and shared recipes replacing loneliness.

ai_analysis.summary: Cooking becomes the language of healing and connection for exchange students.

story.title: Coffee After the War
story.content: I sat with two men who had once fought on opposite sides. They laughed over bitter coffee and old football matches. When I asked what changed, one said, 'We got tired of hating.' That moment — that quiet peace — was worth a lifetime of study.

ai_analysis.summary: A powerful encounter showing how shared humanity outlasts conflict.
